ai.summary: A 6.6 km circular hike in the United Kingdom, rated moderate, offering a mix of rural paths and brief road sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly grassy and compact footpaths with hedges, occasional stiles, and some uneven or muddy sections; may include brief road crossings.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast; weather in the UK can change quickly. Wear sturdy boots with good grip. Bring a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a whistle. Stay on marked paths, watch for traffic on road sections, and allow extra time in wet conditions. Let someone know your planned route and expected return.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map or GPS device; fully charged phone with offline maps
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen) and/or warm layers depending on season
ai.best_seasons: Generally best in spring to autumn for longer daylight and drier paths; can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear.
